title: (x) old gothic woodtype face - (similar to) H&FJ Knockout {Stephen}
content:
i can’t figure out what a typeface is on an old letterpress poster that i own. it’s from the 40s.

take a look at these two figures, which are Gothic 13. The upper case Q is identical to the gothic 13 Q that i’ve attached. same for the lower case t, which is pretty distinctive. however, the uppercase R doesn’t match Gothic 13’s.

any of you guys know any typefaces that also have these characteristics, other than old Gothic 13?:

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Q.gif](http://web.archive.org/system/files?file=Q.gif) | 1.45 KB |
| [t.gif](http://web.archive.org/system/files?file=t.gif) | 1.06 KB |
author: willdean

comments.content: That ‘t’ is very [Knockout](http://web.archive.org/web/20051127094429/http:/www.typography.com/catalog/knockout/index.html). I don’t know much about wood typefaces, but reading about Hoefler’s influences for Champion/Knockout might help you.

yeah. one of the inspirations for champion and knockout has got to be it. the upper case R is just like Franklin gothic bold condensed- i’m still holding out that it’s all in the same semi-mysterious old wood typeface, but there’s always the possibility that someone mixed characters from different families. the lower case t is so recognizeable- definitely not franklin gothic.
